description.narrative: Identify and elevate new solutions to address development issues in Sudan through three protocols of operation - solutions mapping, collective intelligence and experimentation to understand what works and what does not, to help us progress.

sector.narrative: Build resilience to shocks and crisis

condition.narrative: UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative:
indicators Output 1: UNDP Country Offices and partners will have increased capability for scanning, sensemaking and experimentation for sustainable development solutions in 60 developing countries. 1.1 Number of new data sources used at Country Office level. 1.2 Diversity of different data sources used 1.3 Number of sustainable development solutions identified and documented 1.4 Variety of innovation methods used to test and iterate over the different hypotheses. Output 2: New sustainable development solutions will be scaled at country level as part of UNDP’s country programme and operations, national policy and/or local markets. 2.1 Learning the Accelerator Lab Network shares with a public audience (outside of UNDP) 2.2 Number of lab insights, processes or products which are taken up by governments or other partners 2.3 Proportion of partners and governments that increase their take up of the innovation methods included in the Accelerator Lab Network suite 2.4 Proportion of UNDP Country Office programming influenced by the Accelerator Lab Network’s work and methodologies Output 3: A core global level result will be that a global learning and scaling network is established and functioning. 3.1 Size and density of the network effects among the Accelerator Labs 3.2 Number of new models, approaches, and insights documented and disseminated throughout the network. 3.3 Engagement of the broader Development ecosystem with published learnings from the Accelerator Lab Network. 3.4 Amount of influence the learnings and methods of the Accelerator Lab Networks have on the discourse of the broader Development ecosystem.
2.1 Setup of Accelerator Lab office
2.2 Number of solutions experimented and surfaced through collective intelligence methods.
2.3 Diversity of national level partners for Accelerator Lab
3.1 Indicator 1.2.1 SCIN Project Structure developed 1.2.2 Number of neighbourhood committees engaged for the SCIN in the State of Khartoum 1.2.3 Number of aca

1.2.1: None 1.2.2: 5 Neighbourhood committees in Khartoum State mapped 1.2.3: Academic research instituions mapped by the SCIAN Coordinator 1.2.4: 6 Expert groups engaged on evidence-based policy development 1.2.5 UNDP CO SPPC Unit private sector ecosystem map
2.3.1 Solutions Mapping Field and Facilitator Guide 2.3.2 Microsoft AI for Culture and KIWA Languague Solution
Baseline 3.3 CORE Acclab members recruited Head of Exploration/Experimentation/solutions

Output 1: UNDP Country Offices and partners will have increased capability for scanning, sensemaking and experimentation for sustainable development solutions in 60 developing countries. 1.1 5 new data sources per year 1.2 6 different type of data sources per year 1.3 35 new potential solutions per lab per year 1.4 5 innovation methods per Action Plan.
Output 2: New sustainable development solutions will be scaled at country level as part of UNDP’s country programme and operations, national policy and/or local markets. 2.1 At least 6 blogs or other (substantial) media posts published per year 2.2 At least 50% of our learning challenges have the public sector or other partner as counterpart 2.3 At least one government entity or partner has adopted an accelerator lab method. 2.4 At least 50% of our learning challenges are providing actionable knowledge to ongoing CO projects.
Output 3: A core global level result will be that a global learning and scaling network is established and functioning. 3.1 The lab interacts at least once a week with another lab in the network. 48 interaction per year 3.2 25% of information shared across the network should be methodology, or sustainable development issue and opportunity related. 3.3.1 The Accelerator Lab Networks work is featured at least 3 times per month in Country Office Social Media channels and tag UNDP Accelerator Labs accounts. 3.3.2 The Lab team engages at least once a month across any social media conversation related to the work of the Accelerator Lab Network, from either personal or CO account. 3.4.1 Connect the Accelerator Lab’s publications to local development ecosystem through social media 3.4.2 Identify and engage with 5 new relevant local social media profiles of the broader Development Ecosystem.
1.2.1 At least 3 reports generated from SCIN feeding into the Solutions Atlas 1.2.2 at least 15 solutions mapped through at least 3 neighbourhood committees in Khartoum State 1.2.3 at least 15 solutions mapped through at one academic/research institution in Sudan 1.2.4 Sudan Public Policy Network activated with structural framework in place 1.2.5 at least 5 community development solutions mapped through private sector engagement 1.5.1: 150 solutions exhibiting and showcasing their impact in the Sudan Development Forum 1.5.2: 5 diapora engagments and coalitions formed to support the Diaspora portfolio that UNDP leads iloting potential prototypes in real-life context to understand potentional channels of spreading in the public sector 2.1: 10 meeting & workshops conducted in coworking space 2.2.1 At least one positive deviance case identified (not within the health sector) through the Solutions Atlas 2.3.1 200 solutions sampled from the field 2.3.2 Protoytping AI for Culture with Microsoft and KIWA 2.4.1: 100 participants in the experimentation workshop 2.4.2: 200 of youth behaviorally informed 2.4.2: 5 human centered experiments

Output 1: UNDP Country Offices and partners will have increased capability for scanning, sensemaking and experimentation for sustainable development solutions in 60 developing countries. 1.1 5 new data sources identified 1.2 6 different type of data sources identified 1.3 35 new potential solutions identified 1.4 5 innovation methods per Action Plan experimented
Output 2: New sustainable development solutions will be scaled at country level as part of UNDP’s country programme and operations, national policy and/or local markets. 2.1 3 blogs and other (substantial) media posts published per year 2.2 50% of our learning challenges have the public sector or other partner as counterpart 2.3 one government entity or partner has adopted an accelerator lab method. 2.4 50% of our learning challenges are providing actionable knowledge to ongoing CO projects .

Output 2: New sustainable development solutions will be scaled at country level as part of UNDP’s country programme and operations, national policy and/or local markets. 2.1 3 blogs, or other (substantial) media posts published per year. 2.2 At least 50% of our learning challenges have the public sector or other partner as counterpart. 2.3 At least one government entity or partner has learned about Accelerator lab methods 2.4 At least 50% of our learning challenges are providing actionable knowledge to ongoing CO projects.
Output 3: A core global level result will be that a global learning and scaling network is established and functioning.
3.1 The lab interacts at least once a week with another lab in the network. 48 interaction per year 3.2 5% of information shared across the network should be methodology, or sustainable development issue and opportunity related. 3.3.1 The Accelerator Lab Network´s work is featured at least 2 times per month in Country Office Social Media channels and tag UNDP Accelerator Labs accounts. 3.3.2 The Lab team engages at least once a month across any social media conversation related to the work of the Accelerator Lab Network, from either personal or CO account.
3.4.1 Connect the Accelerator Lab’s publications to local development ecosystem through social media. 3.4.2 Identify and engage with 2 new relevant local social media profiles of the broader Development Ecosystem.
1.4 2 innovation methods per Action Plan 1.1.1: Produce 17 murals 1.1.2: 6 (minimum) High Impact Solutions that address transitional period priority areas vetted and submitted for investment recommendation 1.1.3:100 development actors engagingand participating in a 3 days Solutions Fair held in December 2019 1.1.4: One interactive Solutions Atlas digital map and dashboard available and accessible online 1.2.1 Three workshops held in Khartoum for the AccLab soft launch 1.2.2 One workshop held in Alfasher with UNDP staff for the AccLab soft launch 2.1.1: 100 copies of the AccLab Learning Loop report printed and interactive open access online report 2.1.2: 14 Weekly progress meter snapshots shared with AccLab Network weekly reflections and 3 Monthly snapshots supporting the monthly blogs 2.2.1 One Sudan AccLab Network Comms strategy shared and approved by the AccLab Network and UNDP Sudan Comms team 3.1.1: Eco-friendly alternative solutions sourced for CO use to replace plastic water bottles 2.1.1: Target sample sized reached by the SMS survey 2.1.2: 18 states in Sudan reached with the offline survey and target sample size of diaspora respondants 2.2.1: At least 40% positive review on KM system in place based on recommendations 2.2.3: At least 3 emerging issues identified to explore for solutions mapping and experimentation 2.3.1: At least 50 local solutions mapped 2.3.2: One digital interactive map dashboard for locally mapped solutions functioning and available for open access 2.4.1: 15 innovators selected for the incubation program 2.4.2: At least 5 MVPs selected for recommendation to the Transitional Govt for pilot 2.5.1: 2 individuals recruited to join the experimentation team 2.5.2: At least One webinar and workshop conducted to support the capacity building of the experimentation team 2.6.1: One AccLab Experimentation 3.1.1: 3 Core Acclab protocol team members recruited by September 2019 3.1.2: 1 Porject Operations Consultant recruited by November 2019 3.1.3: 1 Online UNV Procurement Expert deployed for two months 3.2.1: Shop/Working Drawing and BOQ submitted by interior designer(s) 3.2.2: Interior refurbishment of the AccLab office and meeting room completed by January 2020 3.2.3: Construction of the AccLab meeting room completed by December 2019 3.3.1: All IT requipment requested delivered to the AccLab by January 2020 3.4.1: 3 Core AccLab Protocol Team members attend the Kigali Bootcamp in August/September 2019 3.4.2: AccLab team attend the SEWF and the BI Clinic

Output 1: UNDP Country Offices and partners will have increased capability for scanning, sensemaking and experimentation for sustainable development solutions in 60 developing countries. 1.1 10 new data sources per year 1.2 9 different type of data sources per year 1.3 50 new potential solutions per lab per year 1.4 10 innovation methods per Action Plan.
Output 2: New sustainable development solutions will be scaled at country level as part of UNDP’s country programme and operations, national policy and/or local markets. 2.1 At least 8 blogs or other (substantial) media posts published per year 2.2 At least 50% of our learning challenges have the public sector or other partner as counterpart 2.3 At least one government entity or partner has adopted an accelerator lab method. 2.4 At least 50% of our learning challenges are providing actionable knowledge to ongoing CO projects.
Output 3: A core global level result will be that a global learning and scaling network is established and functioning. 3.1 The lab interacts at least once a week with another lab in the network. 48 interaction per year 3.2 50% of information shared across the network should be methodology, or sustainable development issue and opportunity related. 3.3.1 The Accelerator Lab Networks work is featured at least 3 times per month in Country Office Social Media channels and tag UNDP Accelerator Labs accounts. 3.3.2 The Lab team engages at least once a month across any social media conversation related to the work of the Accelerator Lab Network, from either personal or CO account. 3.4.1 Connect the Accelerator Lab’s publications to local development ecosystem through social media 3.4.2 Identify and engage with 10 new relevant local social media profiles of the broader Development Ecosystem.
